member.name: T:DotSpatial.Projections.Krovak
member.summary:
Krovak NOTES: According to EPSG the full Krovak projection method should have the following parameters. Within PROJ.4 the azimuth, and pseudo standard parallel are hardcoded in the algorithm and can't be altered from outside. The others all have defaults to match the common usage with Krovak projection.
lat_0 = latitude of centre of the projection
lon_0 = longitude of centre of the projection
** = azimuth (true) of the centre line passing through the centre of the projection
** = latitude of pseudo standard parallel
k = scale factor on the pseudo standard parallel
x_0 = False Easting of the centre of the projection at the apex of the cone
y_0 = False Northing of the centre of the projection at the apex of the cone

member.name: T:DotSpatial.Projections.ProjDescriptor
member.summary: Descriptors are simple classes that are used for storing symbology or other basic characteristics. They are presumed to be made up of value types and other descriptors, and are expected to be serializable. This being said, some basic capabilities are supported for randomizing, copying and comparing the properties of descriptors.

member.name: T:DotSpatial.Projections.IProjMatchable
member.summary: Matching is defined as being a different object, but having properties that would make it indistinguishable from the comparision property. This is an alternative to overriding the equals behavior in cases where you might ALSO need to see if the object reference is the same.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Projections.IProjMatchable.Matches(DotSpatial.Projections.IProjMatchable,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String}@)
member.summary: Tests this object against the comparison object. If any of the value type members are different, or if any of the properties are IMatchable and do not match, then this returns false.
member.param: The other IMatcheable object of the same type
The list of property names that do not match
member.returns: Boolean, true if the properties are comparably equal.

member.summary: IRandomizable

member.param: An existing random number generator so that the random seed can be controlled

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Projections.IProjDescriptor.CopyProperties(System.Object)
member.summary: This copies the public descriptor properties from the specified object to this object.
member.param: An object that has properties that match the public properties on this object.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Projections.ProjDescriptor.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of MatchableObject

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Projections.ProjDescriptor.CopyProperties(System.Object)
member.summary: For each of the publicly accessible properties found on this object, this attempts to copy a public property from the source object of the same name, if it can find it. For each matching property name/type, it will attempt to copy the value.
member.param: The

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Projections.ProjDescriptor.Matches(DotSpatial.Projections.IProjMatchable,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String}@)
member.summary: Compares the properties of this object with the specified IMatchable other. This does not test every property of other, but does test every property of this item. As long as the other item has corresponding properties for every property on this item, the items are said to match. The IMatchable interface allows custom definitions of matching. For collections to match, all of their sub-members must match.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Projections.ProjDescriptor.Randomize(System.Random)
member.summary: The default behavior is to cycle through all the properties of this object, and call Randomize on any that implement the IRandomizable interface.
member.param: The Random seed generator for controling how the random content is created

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Projections.ProjDescriptor.OnCopyProperties(System.Object)
member.summary: This occurs while copying properties from the specified source, and is the default handling for subclasses

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Projections.ProjDescriptor.OnMatch(DotSpatial.Projections.IProjMatchable,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String})
member.summary: This gives sub-classes the chance to directly override, control or otherwise tamper with the matching process. This is also where normal matching is performed, so to replace it, simply don't call the base.OnMatch method. To tweak the results, the base method should be performed first, and the results can then be modified.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Projections.ProjDescriptor.OnRandomize(System.Random)
member.summary: This allows overrideable behavior that can replace or extend the basic behavior, which is to call Randomize on any public properties that are listed as randomizeable. This does nothing to normal properties or non public members and needs to be overriden to provide the special case functionality for sub-classes.
member.param: The random number generator to be used during randomization

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Projections.Spheroid.#ctor(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Creates a new spheroid using an the equatorial radius in meters and a flattening coefficient that is the inverse flattening factor. eg. for WGS84 (6378137.0, 298.257223563)

The inverse of the flattening factor

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Projections.Spheroid.#ctor(System.Double)
member.summary: For perfect spheres, you just need to specify one radius, which will be applied to both radii. You can then directly change the polar or equatorial radius if necessary using the properties.
member.param: The radius of the sphere

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Projections.Spheroid.#ctor(DotSpatial.Projections.Proj4Ellipsoid)
member.summary: The ellps parameter in a proj4 string will only work with certain pre-defined spheroids, enumerated in the Proj4Ellipsoids enumeration. Custom spheroids can be specified but will use the a and b parameters when creating a proj4 parameter instead of using the ellps parameter.
member.param: Any of several predefined geographic ellipses

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Projections.Spheroid.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Given the proj4 code, this will set the radii correctly.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Projections.Spheroid.ReadSedrisCode(System.String)
member.summary: Assigns a known projection that is defined by a two character SEDRIS code, using nothing but that code.
member.param: The two character SEDRIS code defining 22 distinct ellipsoids.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Projections.Spheroid.AssignKnownEllipsoid(DotSpatial.Projections.Proj4Ellipsoid)
member.summary: Given the enumeration of known ellipsoids, this will redefine this spheroid so that it matches the A and B coefficients for the known ellipsoids.
member.param: The known Ellipse

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Projections.Spheroid.FlatteningFactor
member.summary: Calculates the flattening factor, (a - b) / a.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Projections.Spheroid.GetProj4String
member.summary: Uses the current known ellipsoid to return a code name for the proj4 string if possible. Otherwise, this returns the radial parameters a and b.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Projections.Spheroid.Eccentricity
member.summary: Calculates the eccentrity according to e = sqrt(2f - f^2) where f is the flattening factor.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Projections.Spheroid.EccentricitySquared
member.summary: Calculates the square of eccentricity according to es = (2f - f^2) where f is the flattening factor.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Projections.Spheroid.GetInverseFlattening
member.summary: Calculates the inverse of the flattening factor, commonly saved to ESRI projections, or else provided as the "rf" parameter for Proj4 strings. This is simply calculated as a / (a - b) where a is the semi-major axis and b is the semi-minor axis.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Projections.Spheroid.IsOblate
member.summary: Gets a boolean that is true if the spheroid has been flattened.
member.returns: Boolean, true if the spheroid is oblate (or flattened)

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Projections.Spheroid.SetInverseFlattening(System.Double)
member.summary: Sets the value by using the current semi-major axis (Equatorial Radius) in order to calculate the semi-minor axis (Polar Radius).

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Projections.Spheroid.ToEsriString
member.summary: Converts the spheroid parameters into a valid esri expression that uses the semi-major axis and the reciprocal flattening factor

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Projections.Spheroid.ReadEsriString(System.String)
member.summary: Reads the ESRI string to define the spheroid, which controls how flattened the earth's radius is

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Projections.Spheroid.Code
member.summary: Gets or sets the two character Synthetic Environment Data Representation and Interchange Specification (SEDRIS) code eg. AA represents Airy 1830. Setting this will not modify the values, To read a SEDRIS Code use the constructor or AssignKnownEllipsoid overload.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Projections.Spheroid.Proj4Names
member.summary: Each of the enumerated known ellipsoids is encoded by an ellps parameter specified by the corresponding string value. Ellipsoids that are not found here or are specified as "Custom" in the enuemration will be replaced with an 'a' and a 'b' parameter instead.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Projections.Spheroid.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the string name of the spheroid. e.g.: WGS_1984

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Projections.Spheroid.EquatorialRadius
member.summary: A spheroid is a pole flattened (oblate) sphere, with the radii of two axes being equal and longer than the third. This is the radial measure of one of these major axes in meters. e.g. 6,378,137 for WGS 84

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Projections.Spheroid.PolarRadius
member.summary: A spheroid is a pole flattened (oblate) sphere, with the radii of two axes being equal and longer than the third. This is the radial measure of the smaller polar axis in meters. One option is to specify this directly, but it can also be calculated using the major axis and the flattening factor.

member.name: T:DotSpatial.Projections.ProjShallowCopy
member.summary: Normally, cloning an object starts with MemberwiseClone, which creates a shallow copy of the object. For any members that derive from the Descriptor, however, any public properties or fields that implement ICloneable are copied (deep copy behavior). This is not always desirable, even if the member CAN be copied. This attribute causes the deep copy behavior to skip over properties marked with this attribute.
